jobs.title: MBA Intern - Product Operations
jobs.content_plain: <p data-pm-slice="1 1 []"><strong>RDQ227R1170</strong></p> <p>At Databricks, we are passionate about helping data teams solve the world's toughest problems - from making the next mode of transportation a reality to accelerating the development of medical breakthroughs. We do this by building and running the world's best data and AI infrastructure platform so our customers can use deep data insights to improve their business.</p> <p>Join our Product Operations team to ensure our innovations successfully reach our customers and deliver maximum value. As a Product Operations intern, you will sit at the intersection of Product Management, Engineering, and Field teams (Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success). Your mission is to turn product capabilities into market success by driving operational readiness and building data-led feedback loops.</p> <p><strong>The Impact You’ll Make:</strong></p> <ul> <li><strong>GTM Readiness & Execution:</strong> Partner with PMs, ENG, and Field teams to lead the operational rollout of new features, ensuring the organization is equipped with the data and resources needed for a successful launch.</li> <li><strong>Customer Feedback Loops:</strong> Synthesize insights from customer feedback, product usage metrics, and partner inputs to provide Engineering and PM with a clear, data-backed view of market needs.</li> <li><strong>Performance Insights:</strong> Build and maintain the dashboards that track product adoption and health, leveraging SQL to provide the "ground truth" on how features are performing in the wild.</li> <li><strong>Operational Efficiency:</strong> Identify friction points in how information flows from Product to the Field and implement lean processes to keep teams aligned during rapid launch cycles.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Who You Are:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Currently enrolled in a top-tier MBA program with 3–5 years of professional experience (e.g., Consulting, BizOps, or Strategy) and a passion for the "last mile" of product delivery.</li> <li>Advanced SQL skills are required. You are a data native who uses queries to find the "why" behind product trends and adoption hurdles.</li> <li>You are willing to get hands-on. You don't just identify a gap in a launch plan; you build the checklist or dashboard to close it.</li> <li>You can build rapport with technical PMs and Engineering leads while speaking the language of our Sales and Customer Success teams.</li> <li>You understand that "strategy" only matters if it can be executed. You focus on making programs work in the real world with limited guidance.</li> </ul><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p> </p> <p><strong>Pay Range Transparency</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-size: 14px;">Databricks is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The pay range(s) for this role is listed below and represents the expected salary range for non-commissionable roles or on-target earnings for commissionable roles.  Actual compensation packages are based on several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to job-related skills, depth of experience, relevant certifications and training, and specific work location. Based on the factors above, Databricks anticipates utilizing the full width of the range. The total compensation package for this position may also include eligibility for annual performance bonus, equity, and the benefits listed above. For more information regarding which range your location is in visit our page <a href="https://www.databricks.com/sites/default/files/2024-08/us-pay-zone-mapping.pdf">here</a>.<br></span></p> <p> </p></div><div class="title">SF Bay Area Hourly Rate</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$40</span><span class="divider">—</span><span>$40 USD</span></div></div></div><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>About Databricks</strong></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif;">Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on <span style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);"><a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://twitter.com/databricks" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://twitter.com/databricks&source=gmail&ust=1700237575733000&usg=AOvVaw03FL8fJvOD97ytN02f5G2C">Twitter</a>, <a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/databricks" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.linkedin.com/company/databricks&source=gmail&ust=1700237575733000&usg=AOvVaw15dLk3q8VxTfHEgCUg7NSt">LinkedIn</a> <span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">and</span> <a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://www.facebook.com/databricksinc" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.facebook.com/databricksinc&source=gmail&ust=1700237575733000&usg=AOvVaw39EcncitnlqV72EG2-RqXJ">Facebook</a></span>.<br><br><strong>Benefits<br><br></strong></span>At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit <a href="https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks">https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks</a>. <br><br></p> <p><strong>Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion</strong></p> <p>At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.</p> <p><strong>Compliance</strong></p> <p><strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.</span></strong></p></div>

jobs.title: Head of Security & Observability ISV Partnerships
jobs.content_plain: <p data-pm-slice="1 1 []">RDQ427R158</p> <p>As the Head of Security & Observability ISV Partnerships, you will be responsible for recruiting, developing, and scaling a global partner ecosystem that makes Databricks the best place to run data-and-AI-intensive security and observability workloads. You will own strategy and execution with top ISVs across cybersecurity (identity, endpoint, governance, compliance, data protection, threat detection) and observability (logging, monitoring, APM, telemetry) — building integrations, co-creating joint GTM plays, and helping our field and customers realize the value of combining Databricks with leading security and observability partners.</p> <p>We are looking for someone who has “seen the movie” on what works and what doesn’t at one or more hyperscalers and, ideally, has also worked at a leading cybersecurity or observability ISV. The role demands both technical and GTM acumen — able to work with Product and Engineering teams on integrations across identity, governance, logging, and monitoring, as well as with Sales and Marketing teams on go-to-market execution. It is a fast-paced, cross-functional role requiring strong communication, prioritization, and presentation skills, and the ability to quickly context-switch between product, engineering, and field conversations. Success will require deep subject matter expertise in large-scale technology ecosystems, coupled with a scrappy, entrepreneurial spirit to build high-quality programs that establish Databricks as the best place to run security and observability workloads for years to come.</p> <p data-renderer-start-pos="2006"><strong data-renderer-mark="true">The impact you will have: </strong></p> <ul> <li>Define and execute Databricks’ security and observability ISV partnership strategy, including segmentation, prioritization, and success metrics.</li> <li>Own executive and working-level relationships with top security and observability ISVs to drive integrations and joint field execution.</li> <li>Partner with Product and Security/Trust teams to design, validate, and launch integrations that enhance governance, compliance, security, and observability for Databricks customers.</li> <li>Build joint value propositions and scalable GTM motions with ISVs that resonate with CISOs, compliance officers, observability leaders, and data practitioners.</li> <li>Partner with Sales leadership to design and land co-sell plays, enablement, and incentives that bring joint solutions to market.</li> <li>Drive co-marketing initiatives and category-level campaigns with Marketing to generate joint demand.</li> <li>Represent Databricks externally with partners, customers, and industry forums.</li> <li>Advocate internally for partner and customer needs, influencing product roadmap and GTM strategy.</li> </ul> <p data-renderer-start-pos="2367"><strong data-renderer-mark="true">What we look for:</strong></p> <ul> <li>10+ years in product partnerships, business development, or partner management, including 7+ years focused on security, observability, or cloud ecosystems.</li> <li>Proven success launching ISV integrations and GTM motions in security and/or observability with hyperscalers, with a track record of delivering measurable partner-sourced or partner-influenced revenue.</li> <li>Deep understanding and network across cybersecurity and observability ecosystems — identity, governance, compliance, threat detection, data protection, logging, monitoring, and APM, and ability to develop joint value propositions that resonate with technical and business decision-makers alike.</li> <li>Strong cross-functional leadership skills — able to influence Product, Engineering, Sales, Marketing, and Security/Trust teams.</li> <li>Experience navigating co-opetition dynamics and sensitive partner relationships.</li> <li>Excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills — able to build crisp narratives for executive and C-level audiences.</li> <li>Grit, humility, and the ability to operate in a high-growth, founder-led environment.</li> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field; or equivalent practical experience.<br><br></li> </ul> <p data-renderer-start-pos="2367"> </p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p> </p> <p><strong>Pay Range Transparency</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-size: 14px;">Databricks is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The pay range(s) for this role is listed below and represents the expected salary range for non-commissionable roles or on-target earnings for commissionable roles.  Actual compensation packages are based on several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to job-related skills, depth of experience, relevant certifications and training, and specific work location. Based on the factors above, Databricks anticipates utilizing the full width of the range. The total compensation package for this position may also include eligibility for annual performance bonus, equity, and the benefits listed above. For more information regarding which range your location is in visit our page <a href="https://www.databricks.com/sites/default/files/2024-08/us-pay-zone-mapping.pdf">here</a>.<br></span></p> <p> </p></div><div class="title">Zone 1 Pay Range</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$205,700</span><span class="divider">—</span><span>$282,800 USD</span></div></div><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p> </p> <p><strong>Pay Range Transparency</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-size: 14px;">Databricks is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The total compensation package for this position may also include eligibility for annual performance bonus, equity, and the benefits listed above. For more information regarding which range your location is in visit our page <a href="https://www.databricks.com/sites/default/files/2024-08/us-pay-zone-mapping.pdf">here</a>.<br></span></p> <p> </p></div><div class="title">Zone 2 Pay Range</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$185,100</span><span class="divider">—</span><span>$254,550 USD</span></div></div></div><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>About Databricks</strong></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif;">Databricks is the data and AI company. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on <span style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);"><a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://twitter.com/databricks" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://twitter.com/databricks&source=gmail&ust=1700237575733000&usg=AOvVaw03FL8fJvOD97ytN02f5G2C">Twitter</a>, <a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/databricks" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.linkedin.com/company/databricks&source=gmail&ust=1700237575733000&usg=AOvVaw15dLk3q8VxTfHEgCUg7NSt">LinkedIn</a> <span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">and</span> <a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://www.facebook.com/databricksinc" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.facebook.com/databricksinc&source=gmail&ust=1700237575733000&usg=AOvVaw39EcncitnlqV72EG2-RqXJ">Facebook</a></span>.<br><br><strong>Benefits<br><br></strong></span>At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. jobs.title: Legal Intern
jobs.location: Mountain View, California; San Francisco, California
jobs.content_plain: <p><strong>GAQ227R1</strong></p> <p>Work at the nexus of law and innovation with a recognized global leader in Data and AI.  As a Databricks Legal Intern, you won’t just observe, you’ll jump straight into novel legal issues working alongside our high-impact global legal team. You will gain first-hand experience on how an in-house legal department drives business strategy and tackles complex challenges on a daily basis, and navigate cutting-edge legal landscape of generative AI, cloud computing, and big data.  Databricks will encourage you to get out of your comfort zone and provide the resources, mentoring, and feedback you need to grow your legal skills and career.</p> <p>This is a hybrid, in-person position located in our San Francisco and Mountain View offices.  The position offers exposure to a variety of legal practice areas and allows for potential deep dives of areas including: Commercial and Go-to-Market, Privacy, IP, Product & Privacy, Legal Compliance & Ethics, Corporate, Employment & Litigation, and others. You and our other legal interns will work with mentors within Legal as well as join our summer 2026 intern cohort where you'll have the opportunity to connect with other interns, cross-functional teams and leaders not just within our department, but across the company.</p> <p><strong>The impact you will have:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Work with various Databricks Legal teams to support all areas of our business</li> <li>Research and teach our Legal department about novel legal issues, especially as they relate to AI and cloud technology</li> <li>Further Legal strategy and objectives through the development of critical work product and/or assets that will inform future initiatives</li> <li>Contribute to mission-critical projects and initiatives across a variety of practice areas, including Commercial and Go-to-Market, Privacy, IP, Product & Privacy, Legal Compliance & Ethics, Corporate, Employment & Litigation, and others to gain broad exposure to our business and operations</li> <li>Help Databricks continue to balance legal risks as it continues on its exciting path forward</li> </ul> <p><strong>What we look for:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Currently enrolled as a 1st-year (1L) or 2nd-year (2L) law student (graduating in summer 2027 or summer 2028), with a strong record of academic performance</li> <li>Eagerness to learn about Databricks technology and new legal issues</li> <li>Willingness to roll-up your sleeves and tackle tough problems with the full support of our team</li> <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li> <li>Ability to work both independently and with colleagues as needed </li> <li>Exceptional legal research, analytical, and organizational skills, along with a strong foundation in advocacy and judgment</li> <li>High-level legal drafting skills that is consistent with current legal education and experience</li> <li>A desire to be part of a dynamic legal team supporting the recognized leader in processing big data in the cloud</li> <li>Prior background or strong interest in technology, data analytics and Artificial Intelligence (preferred but not required)</li> </ul> <p><strong>Additional Program Details:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Internship program starts on June 8, 2026 and ends August 7, 2026</li> <li>Position is full-time (40 hours per week)</li> <li>This is a hybrid, in-person role, requiring a minimum of three days per week in our San Francisco or Mountain View offices</li> <li>Applications will be accepted on a rolling basis through mid- to late- February; interviews may begin as early as mid-January</li> <li>Application packages should include:  resume, law school transcript, undergraduate transcript, law school writing sample, and a cover letter describing why you are interested in Databricks and this program</li> </ul><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p> </p> <p><strong>Pay Range Transparency</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-size: 14px;">Databricks is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The pay range(s) for this role is listed below and represents the expected salary range for non-commissionable roles or on-target earnings for commissionable roles.  Actual compensation packages are based on several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to job-related skills, depth of experience, relevant certifications and training, and specific work location. Based on the factors above, Databricks anticipates utilizing the full width of the range. The total compensation package for this position may also include eligibility for annual performance bonus, equity, and the benefits listed above. For more information regarding which range your location is in visit our page <a href="https://www.databricks.com/sites/default/files/2024-08/us-pay-zone-mapping.pdf">here</a>.<br></span></p> <p> </p></div><div class="title">SF Bay Area Hourly Rate</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$40</span><span class="divider">—</span><span>$40 USD</span></div></div></div><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>About Databricks</strong></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif;">Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on <span style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);"><a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://twitter.com/databricks" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://twitter.com/databricks&source=gmail&ust=1700237575733000&usg=AOvVaw03FL8fJvOD97ytN02f5G2C">Twitter</a>, <a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/databricks" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.linkedin.com/company/databricks&source=gmail&ust=1700237575733000&usg=AOvVaw15dLk3q8VxTfHEgCUg7NSt">LinkedIn</a> <span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">and</span> <a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://www.facebook.com/databricksinc" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.facebook.com/databricksinc&source=gmail&ust=1700237575733000&usg=AOvVaw39EcncitnlqV72EG2-RqXJ">Facebook</a></span>.<br><br><strong>Benefits<br><br></strong></span>At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit <a href="https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks">https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks</a>. <br><br></p> <p><strong>Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion</strong></p> <p>At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.</p> <p><strong>Compliance</strong></p> <p><strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.</span></strong></p></div>

jobs.title: Product Management Intern (2026) - Berlin
jobs.content_plain: <p>P-1452</p> <p>At Databricks, we are passionate about helping data teams solve the world's toughest problems — from making the next mode of transportation a reality to accelerating the development of medical breakthroughs. We do this by building and running the world's best data and AI infrastructure platform so our customers can use deep data insights to improve their business.</p> <p>As a Product<strong> </strong>Management<strong> </strong>Intern,<strong> </strong>you will<strong> </strong>join a<strong> </strong>team that works diligently to understand and solve our customers' most challenging problems<strong>. </strong>You will learn how to be a successful PM at a high-growth enterprise technology company that operates at the<strong> </strong>important<strong> </strong>intersection of data and AI. We're hiring across all of our teams, including Machine Learning, Unity Catalog,<strong> </strong>Databricks SQL, ETL, Streaming, EDA, and<strong> </strong>Content Organization. You will have a dedicated mentor and will join our 2026 intern cohort where you'll connect with product managers, engineers, designers, account teams, other interns, and leaders from across the company.</p> <p>This is a 12 week paid summer internship program in either Amsterdam or Berlin.</p> <p><strong>The impact you will have:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Work with a team to build features for the Databricks platform</li> <li>Manage your project end-to-end, including design, code, and feedback</li> <li>Learn about building a platform that scales quickly while maintaining quality and security</li> </ul> <p><strong>What we look for:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Pursuing a degree in computer science or related engineering subject</li> <li>You have some experience with SQL and/or Python</li> <li>You use analytical skills to make data-driven decisions (e.g. analyze product usage)</li> <li>You can make complex topics simple and clearly communicate nuance to partners (engineers, customers, field, etc.) in both written and verbal form</li> <li>You are excited to solve ambiguous problems with a collaborative team</li> </ul><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>About Databricks</strong></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif;">Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on <span style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);"><a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://twitter.com/databricks" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://twitter.com/databricks&source=gmail&ust=1700237575733000&usg=AOvVaw03FL8fJvOD97ytN02f5G2C">Twitter</a>, <a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/databricks" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.linkedin.com/company/databricks&source=gmail&ust=1700237575733000&usg=AOvVaw15dLk3q8VxTfHEgCUg7NSt">LinkedIn</a> <span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">and</span> <a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://www.facebook.com/databricksinc" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.facebook.com/databricksinc&source=gmail&ust=1700237575733000&usg=AOvVaw39EcncitnlqV72EG2-RqXJ">Facebook</a></span>.<br><br><strong>Benefits<br><br></strong></span>At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit <a href="https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks">https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks</a>. <br><br></p> <p><strong>Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion</strong></p> <p>At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We do this by building and running the world's best data and AI infrastructure platform so our customers can use deep data insights to improve their business.</p> <p>As a Product<strong> </strong>Management<strong> </strong>Intern,<strong> </strong>you will<strong> </strong>join a<strong> </strong>team that works diligently to understand and solve our customers' most challenging problems<strong>. </strong>You will learn how to be a successful PM at a high-growth enterprise technology company that operates at the<strong> </strong>important<strong> </strong>intersection of data and AI. We're hiring across all of our teams, including Machine Learning, Unity Catalog,<strong> </strong>Databricks SQL, ETL, Streaming, EDA, and<strong> </strong>Content Organization. You will have a dedicated mentor and will join our 2026 intern cohort where you'll connect with product managers, engineers, designers, account teams, other interns, and leaders from across the company.</p> <p>This is a 12 week paid summer internship program in either Amsterdam or Berlin.</p> <p><strong>The impact you will have:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Work with a team to build features for the Databricks platform</li> <li>Manage your project end-to-end, including design, code, and feedback</li> <li>Learn about building a platform that scales quickly while maintaining quality and security</li> </ul> <p><strong>What we look for:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Pursuing a degree in computer science or related engineering subject</li> <li>You have some experience with SQL and/or Python</li> <li>You use analytical skills to make data-driven decisions (e.g. analyze product usage)</li> <li>You can make complex topics simple and clearly communicate nuance to partners (engineers, customers, field, etc.) in both written and verbal form</li> <li>You are excited to solve ambiguous problems with a collaborative team</li> </ul><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>About Databricks</strong></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif;">Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on <span style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);"><a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://twitter.com/databricks" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://twitter.com/databricks&source=gmail&ust=1700237575733000&usg=AOvVaw03FL8fJvOD97ytN02f5G2C">Twitter</a>, <a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/databricks" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.linkedin.com/company/databricks&source=gmail&ust=1700237575733000&usg=AOvVaw15dLk3q8VxTfHEgCUg7NSt">LinkedIn</a> <span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">and</span> <a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://www.facebook.com/databricksinc" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.facebook.com/databricksinc&source=gmail&ust=1700237575733000&usg=AOvVaw39EcncitnlqV72EG2-RqXJ">Facebook</a></span>.<br><br><strong>Benefits<br><br></strong></span>At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit <a href="https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks">https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks</a>. <br><br></p> <p><strong>Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion</strong></p> <p>At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.</p> <p><strong>Compliance</strong></p> <p><strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.</span></strong></p></div>

jobs.title: Software Engineering Intern (2026)
jobs.content_plain: <p>P-1340</p> <p>At Databricks, we are passionate about helping data teams solve the world's toughest problems — from making the next mode of transportation a reality to accelerating the development of medical breakthroughs. We do this by building and running the world's best data and AI infrastructure platform so our customers can use deep data insights to improve their business.</p> <p>As a Software Engineering Intern, you will join a team of engineers to build features that contribute directly to the Databricks platform. We're hiring across all of our teams, including full stack, backend, infrastructure, systems, tools, cloud, databases, and customer-facing products. You will have a dedicated mentor and will join our 2026 intern cohort where you'll connect with engineers, other interns, and leaders from across the company.</p> <p>We are hiring Software Engineering Interns across multiple offices. Please apply for the single location that you're most interested in, and we will discuss more with you as you move through the process. We can only consider one application in 30 days. </p> <p><strong>The impact you will have:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Work with a team to build features for the Databricks platform</li> <li>Manage your project end-to-end, including design, code, and feedback</li> <li>Learn about building a platform that scales quickly while maintaining quality and security</li> </ul> <p><strong>What we look for:</strong></p> <ul> <li>You will graduate between fall 2026 and Summer 2027 with a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related subject</li> <li>You have implementation skills with a general purpose program language, such as Python, Java, or C++</li> <li>You have good knowledge of algorithms, data structures, and OOP principles</li> <li>You are excited to solve ambiguous problems with a collaborative team</li> </ul> <p> </p><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>About Databricks</strong></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif;">Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit <a href="https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks">https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks</a>. <br><br></p> <p><strong>Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion</strong></p> <p>At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.</p> <p><strong>Compliance</strong></p> <p><strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.</span></strong></p></div>

jobs.title: PhD GenAI Research Scientist Intern
jobs.content_plain: <p><strong>Company Description:</strong></p> <p>At Databricks, we are obsessed with enabling data teams to solve the world’s toughest problems, from security threat detection to cancer drug development. We do this by building and running the world’s best data and AI platform, so our customers can focus on the high value challenges that are central to their own missions.</p> <p>The Mosaic AI organization enables companies to develop AI models and systems using their own data, with technologies ranging from fine-tuning LLMs for enterprise domains, to a platform for building compound AI systems that use retrieval and agents. Mosaic AI is committed to the belief that a company’s AI models are just as valuable as any other core IP, and that high-quality AI models should be available to all.</p> <p><strong>Job description:</strong></p> <p>Most of the world's data+AI problems lie in enterprise domains, behind closed doors. Our research team's goal is to push the frontier of "domain adaptation" - how can we develop LLMs and AI systems that work well for custom domains. To do this we are tackling open research problems on a range of topics, from how to scale/automate eval, fine tune with synthetic data, retrieval augmentation, fast/efficient inference and more. </p> <p>You will work with our research team on projects focused on adapting LLMs and AI systems towards enterprise domains. This may include:</p> <ul> <li>Adapting, improving, and evaluating a method from the literature.</li> <li>Designing an entirely new method for domain adaptation.</li> <li>Composing together multiple methods to create new recipes for efficient post-training.</li> <li>Evaluation of LLMs and AI systems. </li> </ul> <p><strong>Your qualifications and qualities:</strong></p> <ul> <li> Required:</li> <ul> <li>Research experience in and proficiency with the fundamentals of deep learning.</li> <li>Pursuing a PhD in computer science or related fields (electrical engineering, neuroscience, physics, math, etc.).</li> <li>Proficient software engineering skills, including with PyTorch.</li> </ul> </ul><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p> </p> <p><strong>Pay Range Transparency</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-size: 14px;">Databricks is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The pay range(s) for this role is listed below and represents the expected salary range for non-commissionable roles or on-target earnings for commissionable roles.  Actual compensation packages are based on several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to job-related skills, depth of experience, relevant certifications and training, and specific work location. Based on the factors above, Databricks anticipates utilizing the full width of the range. The total compensation package for this position may also include eligibility for annual performance bonus, equity, and the benefits listed above. For more information regarding which range your location is in visit our page <a href="https://www.databricks.com/sites/default/files/2024-08/us-pay-zone-mapping.pdf">here</a>.<br></span></p> <p> </p></div><div class="title">SF Bay Area Hourly Rate</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$54</span><span class="divider">—</span><span>$60 USD</span></div></div></div><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>About Databricks</strong></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif;">Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on <span style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);"><a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://twitter.com/databricks" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://twitter.com/databricks&source=gmail&ust=1700237575733000&usg=AOvVaw03FL8fJvOD97ytN02f5G2C">Twitter</a>, <a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/databricks" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.linkedin.com/company/databricks&source=gmail&ust=1700237575733000&usg=AOvVaw15dLk3q8VxTfHEgCUg7NSt">LinkedIn</a> <span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">and</span> <a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://www.facebook.com/databricksinc" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.facebook.com/databricksinc&source=gmail&ust=1700237575733000&usg=AOvVaw39EcncitnlqV72EG2-RqXJ">Facebook</a></span>.<br><br><strong>Benefits<br><br></strong></span>At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit <a href="https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks">https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks</a>. <br><br></p> <p><strong>Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion</strong></p> <p>At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.</p> <p><strong>Compliance</strong></p> <p><strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.</span></strong></p></div>

jobs.title: Software Engineer Internship / Co-op, Applied Emerging Talent (Fall 2026)
jobs.content_text:
About the Team

The Applied team works across research, engineering, product, and design to bring OpenAI’s technology to the world. We seek to learn from deployment and broadly distribute the benefits of AI, while ensuring that this powerful tool is used responsibly and safely. We aim to make our innovative tools globally accessible, transcending geographic, economic, or platform barriers. Our commitment is to facilitate the use of AI to enhance lives, fostered by rigorous insights into how people use our products.

About the Role

We are seeking Software Engineering Interns (Emerging Talent) to join our Applied Engineering teams. You’ll work in a highly iterative, collaborative, fast-paced environment to bring our technology to millions of users around the world, and ensure it’s delivered with safety and reliability in mind. We value engineers who are self-starters, care deeply about the end user experience, and take pride in building products to solve customer needs.

This is a 15-week, paid, in-person internship based in our San Francisco, CA office during Fall 2026.

In this role, you will:

  • Build new customer-facing ChatGPT and OpenAI API features and product experiences end-to-end

  • Collaborate with a cross-functional team of engineers, researchers, product managers, designers, and operations folks to create cutting-edge products

  • Optimize applications for speed and scale

  • Create a diverse and inclusive culture that makes all feel welcome.

Your background looks something like:

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or relevant technical field

  • Must have at least one semester of schooling left after the completion of your internship

  • Proficiency with JavaScript, React, and some backend languages (we use Python)

  • Some experience with relational databases like Postgres/MySQL

  • Interest in AI/ML (direct experience not required)

  • Ability to move fast in an environment where things are sometimes loosely defined and may have competing priorities or deadlines

About OpenAI

OpenAI is an AI research and deployment company dedicated to ensuring that general-purpose artificial intelligence benefits all of humanity. We push the boundaries of the capabilities of AI systems and seek to safely deploy them to the world through our products. AI is an extremely powerful tool that must be created with safety and human needs at its core, and to achieve our mission, we must encompass and value the many different perspectives, voices, and experiences that form the full spectrum of humanity. 

We are an equal opportunity employer, and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or other applicable legally protected characteristic.

For additional information, please see OpenAI’s Affirmative Action and Equal Employment Opportunity Policy Statement.

Background checks for applicants will be administered in accordance with applicable law, and qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment consistent with those laws, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers, and the California Fair Chance Act, for US-based candidates. For unincorporated Los Angeles County workers: we reasonably believe that criminal history may have a direct, adverse and negative relationship with the following job duties, potentially resulting in the withdrawal of a conditional offer of employment: protect computer hardware entrusted to you from theft, loss or damage; return all computer hardware in your possession (including the data contained therein) upon termination of employment or end of assignment; and maintain the confidentiality of proprietary, confidential, and non-public information. In addition, job duties require access to secure and protected information technology systems and related data security obligations.

To notify OpenAI that you believe this job posting is non-compliant, please submit a report through this form. No response will be provided to inquiries unrelated to job posting compliance.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities, and requests can be made via this link.

OpenAI Global Applicant Privacy Policy

At OpenAI, we believe artificial intelligence has the potential to help people solve immense global challenges, and we want the upside of AI to be widely shared. Join us in shaping the future of technology.
